Interesting analysis as ever. I recall a certain interview with Jeremy Paxman where Tony Blair would have loved to have his hands on these numbers!

Fascinating piece of work. There is another possibility as a rider to the condition "immediately detain" - and that is that the Immigration officials don't step in at this stage to detain the persons, because the police are in any event proceeding against them for an alleged criminal offence. I.e. the criminal proceedings take precedence.

There are plenty of problems with this,as you acknowledge. One is that the UKBA often do not follow up cases from countries where returning illegals is very difficult, nor those who are like like to claim asylum so your key figure of 155 may well be only those judged "returnable". Secondly, the LSE estimate only allowed for 50,000 overstayers in seven years from among 12 million granted visas between 2001 and 2007. A separate estimate, based on remittances, suggested an illegal population of 200,000 from Pakistan alone.See http://www.migrationwatchuk.org/briefingPaper/document/190
